A Short Grace after meals

Such tastes delighted our tongues. We ate and are satisfied. Blessed are you, of whose bounty we eat. Blessed are you who satisfy and delight.

Sources: Jewish Tradition / The Bible Devarim 8-10

Notes: According to R. Nehemiah "Avraham used to receive wayfarers, and after they had eaten he would say to them, 'Now say Grace.' When they asked what to say, he would reply, 'Blessed be the Everlasting God, of whose bounty we have eaten.'" Bereishit Rabbah 54 6
